summary_points: 1. Lamb Weston Holdings, Inc. reported fiscal third-quarter 2025 net sales of $1,521 million, a 4% increase year-over-year, driven by a 9% volume increase offset by a 5% decline in price/mix.
2.  Despite increased net sales,  Adjusted Net Income for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 declined 11% year-over-year to $157 million, while Adjusted Diluted EPS declined 8% to $1.10.
3.  Lamb Weston engaged AlixPartners to evaluate near- and long-term value creation and cost-saving opportunities, planning to provide updates as the work progresses.

1. On April 2nd, 2025, Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. and its subsidiary exchanged $68,451,000 in principal amount of 5.375% Exchangeable Senior Notes due 2025 for $68,451,000 in principal amount of newly issued 0.875% Exchangeable Senior Notes due 2030 and a $12,380,732 cash payment plus accrued interest.

2.  A registered direct offering of 649,565 ordinary shares was announced on April 3rd, 2025, at a price of $19.06 per share, expected to reduce the company's fully diluted shares outstanding by approximately 15.5 million.
3. The closing of the transactions is expected on or about April 7th, 2025, and is predicted to be neutral to the company's leverage.
1. Conagra Brands' net sales decreased by 6.3% in the third quarter of fiscal year 2025 (ended February 23, 2025), with organic net sales down 5.2%.
2.  Diluted earnings per share (EPS) for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 was $0.30, a 53.1% decrease compared to the prior year.

3.  Conagra Brands' fiscal year 2025 guidance remains unchanged, projecting approximately a 2% decrease in organic net sales compared to fiscal year 2024, an adjusted operating margin of approximately 14.4%, and adjusted EPS of approximately $2.35.
1. As of April 2nd, 2025, News Corp had repurchased approximately US$656,411,558.63 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On April 2nd, 2025, News Corp repurchased 21,422,593 Class A shares and 10,571,853 Class B shares.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced in a filing with the Australian Securities Exchange,  intends to continue repurchasing shares subject to market conditions and other factors.
